title: A love triangle and a deadly dog walk: Convicted killer says he got played by girlfriend
description: Army veteran Darrin Lopez is asking for leniency on his 62-year murder conviction. He claims he was played by his girlfriend who convinced him her husband abused her.

title: Trump co-defendant pleads guilty in Georgia election case
description: Scott Hall is the first person to plead guilty in the 19 defendant case in Fulton County, Georgia.

title: Las Vegas police arrest person in connection with Tupac Shakur murder investigation
description: A Nevada man, believed to be the last living suspect investigated in the 1996 slaying of Tupac Shakur, was arrested Friday in connection with the long-unsolved case, law enforcement sources told NBC News.

title: Conservative rebels say they'll tank Kevin McCarthy's funding bill, raising odds of a shutdown
description: Conservatives vow to block House Republicans' short-term funding bill, likely cementing the chances of a painful government shutdown on Sunday.

title: Judge will end former NFL star Michael Oher's conservatorship after 'Blind Side' fallout
description: A judge will end the conservatorship between Michael Oher and the Tuohys months after Oher came forward about discovering he wasn’t adopted by the family in ‘The Blind Side."

title: UAW reveals newest strike locations amid ongoing fight with Detroit's Big Three
description: UAW autoworkers have been striking dozens of General Motors, Ford and Stellantis auto plants since mid-September in an effort to secure a new contract.

title: Millions across the Northeast at risk of flooding, NYC declares start of emergency
Supreme Court to weigh GOP-backed social media ‘censorship’ laws
description: The Supreme Court will decide the constitutionality of Florida and Texas laws that seek to prevent social media companies from banning users for contentious rhetoric.

title: Elon Musk wades into U.S. immigration debate at Texas-Mexico border
description: Billionaire Elon Musk waded into the U.S. immigration debate on Thursday, paying a visit to the Texas border with Mexico to meet with local politicians and law enforcement and obtain what he called an “unfiltered” view of the situation.

title: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, a trailblazer in U.S. politics and the longest-serving woman in the Senate, dies at age 90
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-Calif., a vocal advocate of gun-control measures who was known for trying to find common ground with Republicans during her three decades in the Senate, has died, her office announced Friday.

title: Lawmakers with babies and toddlers push Congress to stop the 'child care cliff'
description: Millions of families are at risk of losing child care after this weekend when emergency funding allocated to providers during the coronavirus pandemic expires.

title: Switching the types of carbs you eat may help prevent weight gain, large study finds
description: A study found that people who increased their whole grains intake, ate more non-starchy vegetables and upped their fruit intake gained less weight over four years.

title: Toby Keith describes 'roller coaster' journey after cancer diagnosis as he receives Country Icon Award
description: Toby Keith spoke out about his “roller coaster” experience following his cancer diagnosis ahead of receiving the Country Icon Award at Thursday’s People’s Choice Country Awards, where he also delivered a performance that brought his wife to tears.

title: Why Biden is taking a hands-off approach to the looming shutdown
description: The last time the U.S. was facing a fiscal crisis, President Joe Biden cut short an overseas trip and swiftly met with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy to try to avert a debt default two weeks before the deadline.

title: Trump is on the witness list for $250 million civil fraud trial starting next week
description: The former president's two adult sons — Don Jr. and Eric — were also named as witnesses by New York Attorney General Letitia James and Trump's attorneys.

title: Fourth person charged with drug offenses after baby dies at Bronx day care
description: The husband of the owner of a New York City day care where a baby died after being exposed to fentanyl was charged with two federal narcotics charges Thursday, prosecutors said.

title: Voicemail is out? New rules for proper phone call etiquette
description: Texting is in, voicemails are out. With each generation using different contact methods, what are the new rules on phone etiquette? NBC News Daily anchors speak with Washington Post tech reporter Heather Kelly on the new ways of calling.
